Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Ah, negative on that request commercial freighter 'Nan-Shan'.  I've already got an inbound on that approach pending a beacon-fix.  Hold on my mark until I get back with some confirmation.  Rimward Traffic Control out.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: That's the second time I ran it, and it still reads the same.

Speaker: urioste
Dialogue: You didn't wipe your feet coming in.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Well, it's okay.  You didn't tell me it was monsoon season going out.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Hey, buenos dias, cowboy.  When d'you blow in?

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Ahh, don't pay any attention to Urioste. She's still pissed that Noguchi wouldn't let her go off on your hunting trip.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Wasn't my trip, I just did the driving. 'Sides, freezing my butt off out in the wet taking pot-shots at the local wildlife isn't my idea of a good time, either.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Camped out by the navi-beacon out on Linson's Range.  They're making their own way back tomorrow.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: MarsCo went belly-up on the Dow Jones.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Yesterday.  We got the Network feed from Gateway; it was the top story on 'Sixty Seconds'.  Biggest market crash since twenty-four.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Fucking great.  I invested some money in them.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: You win some, you loose some.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: I lose 'em all, that's why I'm still out here on this rock.  Anything else you wanna ruin my day with?

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: No, but I got something that might interest you.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: A pair of incomings.  They popped-up on the medium-range about thirteen twenty-four local time.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: We figured on it being a magnetic anomaly, but we ran a back-trace just to make sure.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Yeah.  Turns out they dropped straight out of hyperspace.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Sounds like a couple of escape shuttles.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Have you got an updated Lloyds' Almanac to cross-reff them through?

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: And if you thought that was interesting, watch this...

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Yeah, exactly.  Those're pre-programmed course adjustments you're looking at.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: We ran a trajectory simulation.  If they carry on along that path, it's possible they'll make intra-orbital insertion.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: I don't know what to make of this.  Get a copy of the telemetry relayed back to Antarctica Traffic Control.  Better alert the nearest RimCorp Base, too.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Fort Powell.  What do we tell 'em?

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Just give them the facts.  They can leap to their own conclusions.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: Little fuckers move too fast.  Let's do a sweep and catch 'em on the other side.

Speaker: beauvais
Dialogue: Ahhh, they're just letting off some steam; don't let 'em get to you. Ackland and York aren't such bad guys when you get to know 'em.  Just a couple of weekend warriors...

Speaker: beauvais
Dialogue: Good argument for gun-control.  What are you going after, rhino?

Speaker: minh
Dialogue: Nah.  I just wanna squeeze off a few rounds.  'Sides, they tagged the rhinos for the migration project, so they're protected.  They'll dock you a month's pay for just mentioning it.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: See that sheathing on the suspension? Eaten away.  Same thing with the pumps on the base air purifiers.  The algae out here just isn't good on these new plastics.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: We haven't used Big Bertha since we relocated the generator module. That was four months ago.  I can't ask for them to keep bringing spares in on the shuttle, it's already costing too much as it is.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: If you want these things kept in working condition, that's the only choice you've got.

Speaker: diller
Dialogue: Maybe she wouldn't be so tetchy if she got laid every once-in-a-while.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: I don't know.  I think we'll have to run it on a rota; one month down, one month operational.

Speaker: diller
Dialogue: Miss Noguchi!  You're wanted in admin.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Seven minutes ago, the third course change in an hour.  Those incomings are going to skim past the communications platform just a little too close for comfort.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Can we move it to a different orbit in time?

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Get off an all-bands emergency distress, and put it on a repeater.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Relay station like us out in the middle of the boonies; why bother? All you're gonna do is punch a temporary hole in the traffic control net.  That'd be small potatoes even for terrorists.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Can you patch me a temporary loop on DCMGS?

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Punch me in a solution for their delta-vee.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: A three-second burn to port, on my mark.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: Me either.  I tell you, I used to be with a mining outfit on Callisto, and when something like that hits... believe me, you know about it.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Do you wanna head back and call it in?

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Hey, boss.  Wondered where you'd gotten to.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: I just... wanted to be put on my own for a while.  Clear my head.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Didn't feel like whoopin' it up with the rest of us blue collars, huh?

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: I've got a lot of thinking to do.  'Sides, the room was getting too crowded for me.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Not too much of the socializing type, then?

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: No, not really.  More sort of the  'claustrophobic' type.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Uh-huh.  Used to get it pretty bad.  I'd wake up in a cold sweat and want to claw open a vacuum hatch.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: How long you been out here for now, anyway?  Three months?

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Just curious.  There's a lot of talk goes around.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: I don't know.  I guess I've just never found anywhere I really felt at home.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Nothing.  With the satellite down, we can't transmit over the mountain range. He's most likely sitting there wondering why he can't raise us.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: First light, we'll take a chopper out there and tell them to head back.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: 'We'?  You wanna fly out there with me?

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Sure.  Do me good to stretch my legs.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Don't worry about it.  If the Network goes by the book, like everyone figures they will, a Marine gunboat from Powell'll drop-by for a look- see in four-or-five days.  They can go poke around out there and find whatever it was hit us.  All we've gotta do is sit tight.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Do you think Ackland'll sit tight?

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: There'd have to be a helluva good reason for him not to.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Nada. No radiation... no movement... nothing.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: Well, just keep looking.  It's gotta be... whoa, Jesus!

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: No, it's still breathing.  Kinda clammy though.  Are you sure your stick's not broken.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: God, I hope that thing didn't bring down a virus.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: I told you we... what's that?

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: Looks like a spore.  Fungus of some kind, maybe?

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Bloody big if it is.  Top's open.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: It's hollow.  Think our rhino must've ate something that didn't agree with him.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Let's get back and call this in.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: What is that... is that metal fragments?

Speaker: cut to
Dialogue: ...A SHORT DISTANCE ACROSS THE CLEARING.  SOMETHING is watching them from the trees; something with a heat-vision P.O.V.  A PREDATOR.  We see the flare of ACKLAND's gunshots, then SNAP IN to see the multi- colored from of his body toppling over, trailing a purplish FACEHUGGER, before we...

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Oh, God; oh, shit; oh, God.

Speaker: cut to
Dialogue: A PREDATOR-VISION SHOT, watching the color-bloom of YORK dragging ACKLAND's body away from the crater.  It CLOSES IN on the FACEHUGGER, giving us a muted X-ray-type VIEW of circulatory fluid pumping around the HUGGER and into ACKLAND.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Give me a hand with Ack.

Speaker: beauvais
Dialogue: How bad is... oh my God.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Don't... uuh... don't know.  Help me... uuh... help me get him inside. Shit!

Speaker: beauvais
Dialogue: Have you tried prising it off?

Speaker: york
Dialogue: I wanted to get him back here; get him back to base.

Speaker: minh
Dialogue: Forget it.  We lost the satellite link. It's dead.

Speaker: beauvais
Dialogue: We've got no option.  We're gonna have to get it off.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Get real, Beauvais!  That thing might chew his fucking face off for all be know!

Speaker: beauvais
Dialogue: How do you know it's not already?

Speaker: york
Dialogue: I don't, but I think we should just wait and let the Doc take a look...

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Wake up.  We're at the beacon.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Fabrique Nationale tactical autoloader. Uses twelve mill hollow 'O' rounds, with through the barrel smart laser-sighting. Sure, I can handle this.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Okay.  Watch were you point it...

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Yeah.  Found it curled up in a corner of the tent.  Any idea?

Speaker: revna
Dialogue: Never come across one of these before. Maybe the original survey team did.  I'll run it through records and see what comes up.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Hey, Jan.  See if you can get someone to check out the chopper.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: She was running a little sluggish on the way back.  Think the turbines might be playing up.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Give me twenty minutes and I'll do it myself.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Bagged and in the back.  They're not a pretty sight.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: I'm going to need you to co-sign the report.  Until we come up with something, this'll be treated as first degree murder.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: When we get the link back, and I send this in, I.C.C.'ll throw a fit.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Ah, don't worry about I.C.C.  They're the least of your problems right now.

Speaker: urioste
Dialogue: Sorry.  Can I have a word?

Speaker: urioste
Dialogue: Three-Pump failed a half-hour ago.  The algae must have clogged up an intake duct.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Again?  How long before we start noticing the difference?

Speaker: urioste
Dialogue: I reckon it'll be another day before the smell gets unbearable. Beauvais usually fixes it, but... ah...

Speaker: urioste
Dialogue: Sure, I can manage.  But I'm not going into the Pit on my own.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Yeah, no problem.  Ask Diller, he's good with his hands.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: Hey, c'mon Doc, I feel fine.  Really.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: The head's okay, but I could sink a six-pack.

Speaker: revna
Dialogue: Forget that.  I want you off alcohol for at least seventy-two hours. I've got some toxin build-up tests still to run.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: We... watched a meteor hit over Linson's.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: Yeah, it impacted really off.  We went out to the crash-site... and... uh... that's... that's all.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: Not really, no.  Ugly little sonuvabitch. What is it?

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: We thought you might be able to tell us. I found it by your cot at the camp.  You were out cold.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Beauvais and Minh are dead, Ackland.  York's gone awol, unless you can help us go some way toward disproving our suspicion, he's the prime suspect right now.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: Can I... um... have some water?  Please?

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Ackland?  I don't know him well enough to say.  If we were back on Earth we could run him though an Aldhoven test and find out for sure. There's not much we can do out here.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: You should try this seasoned stuff.  It's good.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Oh, I've been looking for this!  Where was it?

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: You left it in the chopper.  Oh, and before I forget, Don?  I ran that test you wanted on the turbines.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: And, nothing.  They checked out just fine.

Speaker: diller
Dialogue: What's the matter, girl?  You smell something?

Speaker: diller
Dialogue: Yeah.  Never seem 'em act like this before.

Speaker: diller
Dialogue: He looks in a bad way.  Help me get him up to Infirmary.

Speaker: ackland
Dialogue: It's nothing, Doc.  Just a... touch of indigestion... something.

Speaker: revna
Dialogue: That sounds nasty.  I'll give you a couple of Demazine.

Speaker: revna
Dialogue: Hold on, it's alright.  I'm gonna give  you a shot...

Speaker: diller
Dialogue: York just turned up outside.  We're trying to get him into Infirmary.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: The door's sealed from inside.  Doc Revna's in there, and it sounds like Ackland's going nuts.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Get after it, don't let it get away!

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: It left a melted trail on the deck all the way down to here...

Speaker: diller
Dialogue: Secondary fluidic shunt for the sewage system.  I found the grating ripped right off.  The little fucker was strong.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Central Pumping.  All the waste gets  treated, broken-down, and flushed out into the swamp.  If it wanted a quick exit then it really lucked- out.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Do it.  I don't want that thing on my installation.  I want it caught and destroyed.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Cornering it shouldn't be a problem.  Each part of this station is basically a self-sufficient deep-space transport module running off external couplers.  If we disconnect them and seal off every section, we've got a ceiling of about thirty-six hours on internal power.  That should give us ample time to find it.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Alright.  Pull some trackers and headsets out of stores, and I'll sign a release for the weapons.  Cassie, organise a team roster and put it on the board.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: One final point.  Killing this sonuvabitch ought to be a reward in itself.  However, just to add a little incentive... I'm authorizing a hefty bonus in the next pay-packet for whoever does.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: ...I mean, these... these mothers were... were huge.  They look like bushmen, but they had all this hi-tech shit strapped all over 'em. They must've wasted Beauvais and Minh inside thirty seconds.  Minh got off a couple of shots from that cannon of his, but he might as well have been using a B-B gun.  I don't know how the hell I made it out of there alive.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Don't worry about it, Yorkie.  You're safe now.  Go get come rest.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: What do I think?  I think if those Marines from Powell don't shift their butts getting here, we're gonna get caught up to our necks in the middle of something we shouldn't.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: One more sweep... one more sweep.  I'm getting tired of one more fuckin' sweep. We're been lookin' for this thing for three days now, and found zip.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: Ah, quit griping.  Keeps you in shape doesn't it?

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Hey!  I was in shape before we started doing this.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: That's what I mean.  This is the quietest I've ever heard it.  It's unnatural.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Next time you have a thought like that? Keep it to yourself.

Speaker: urioste
Dialogue: No.  I... think that's a regulator valve. Hold on.

Speaker: urioste
Dialogue: They're always like that.  Head-Office are real cheap when it comes to spares.  Wave that thing in the corner...

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: That's impossible, man.  This fence is high-tensile.  The breaking tolerance'd stand up to the strain of a rhino, easy. I know, I put it up.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: There's no way a rhino'd survive that drop.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: Goldsmith's gonna be plenty pissed at losing one of her babies.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: You should hit the sack, too.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Nah, I'll stick it out for another hour or so.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: Give me a yell is something happens.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: What?  Are you nuts?  Just the two of us?

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: I've seen this mother, De Vries.  We can bag it, no problem.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: C'mon De Vries.  Think of the bonus.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: Fuck the bonus.  I hate heights.  You wouldn't get me up there even if it wasn't night.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing?

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Hey, fair enough.  If you won't come, I'll handle it myself.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: It's moving slow.  About... eleven metres. On the left.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: The door to the food storage locker was smashed open.  It must have come straight out of here.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Just behind us, over to the right.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: Can't see a thing.  Are you sure?

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: I dunno.  Might be a glitch.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: No, he's stopped; he's totally still. Just take it nice and easy, babe. Nice and easy...

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: Oh, nice going, man!  It was a lemur! A goddamn lemur!

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Uh... sorry about that, boss.  Everything's fine.  False alarm, that's all.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: Hey, look; let's forget it.  There's nothing up here.

Speaker: urioste
Dialogue: I've dropped my torch into the water. Give me about... uh... a meter- and-a-half's worth of slack.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Move!  Get out of the way!

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Come on, man.  Leave it alone.

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: This is like a bad dream, man.  A bad fucking dream.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Rob?  I want you to evac everybody from the non-connective modules into admin. That goes double for anybody...

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Hey; c'mon now, girl.  It's alright.  Let's just get this knot undone...

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Get your ass out of here, boss!

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: I'm out of ammo.  Get inside, get inside!

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Cassie, thank Christ!  We're under attack.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: The son-of-bitches got into 'E' wing! They're ripping it apart!

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Fuck!  Somebody get over there with some guns!  Now!

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: How many of them are there?

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: Hurry up and figure that thing out, man!

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Matt!  Open these damn doors right now, I'll ream your ass so bad these things out here'll seem like the Easter Bunny in comparison!  Swear to God!

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Open the doors!  Open the goddamned fucking doors!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Close it up, close it up!

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: It you don't... uh!... move your ass, you're gonna need a helluva diet to get through here!

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Everything on this module is locked and sealed.  We've lost 'B', 'C', and 'E' wings, but 'E' was the only one we didn't manage to totally evacuate.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: How many... how many people are missing?

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Unconfirmed reports of eighteen or so far, but the numbers are all over the place.

Speaker: driscoll
Dialogue: Shit!  Our armory's a big blue box from the back shelf of stores.  We got about two clips left for an autoloader, and that's it.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Auto-shop's sealed, but those boys are cut-off.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Don't panic, people.  We've just switched over to internals.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: They knocked out the external feeds.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: We're not gonna make it, are we?

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Communications to auto-shop go through an F.O. link off the main trunk. That's down with the other feeds.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I'm tellin' you, it's impossible.  Nothing can grow and reproduce this fast.

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Yeah.  Right.  You wanna go outside and tell them that?

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: What's keeping those fucking Marines, man? They should'a been here by now!

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: Maybe they ain't coming.  Maybe they don't even know we've got problems...

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: I don't wanna hear that kind of crap, Thomas.  They're coming.  Just a matter of time, that's all...

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Jan, it's Hiroko.  What sort of shape are you in down there?

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Alright, let's keep calm.  We've got to have an option of some sort... there's got to be a way out of this.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Well, what about those other things outside; those warriors?  Maybe we can cut some kind of deal...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Well, it occurred to me that we could use the overhead crane to load the admin module onto the back of Big Bertha.  That way we could put a bit of distance...

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: That sounds promising.  Can we operate the crane from here?

Speaker: driscoll
Dialogue: Nah.  It's got programmable facilities, but it was never rigged for remote operation.  Someone'd have to go up to the cab to get it up and running.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: This is fuckin' lunacy!  You're not gonna make it across the platform on foot!

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: No, he's right.  Has anyone got a bike near here?

Speaker: redheaded girl
Dialogue: Uh... the Hyundai racer.  Yellow and black stripes.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Listen, I don't care if it's pink and purple polka-dots as long as it gets me there in one piece.  Somebody loan me a headset.

Speaker: driscoll
Dialogue: No, go back.  Second clasp from the bottom.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: How much air-time have I got?

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: About thirty minutes.  Those are slimmed-down tanks, so no stopping to admire the scenery.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: We've dumped the whole data-base from one of the cleaning remotes into the helmet. It'll project the route through the sewer system onto the inside of the glass as you go.

Speaker: driscoll
Dialogue: Yeah, I stripped down a motion tracker and hardwired it through to the helmet pick-ups, too.  That's also on the display.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: It's not all good news.  We had to take off the helmet lights.  You'll be going in blind.

Speaker: driscoll
Dialogue: We had to.  They were just too cumbersome for some of the conduits you're gonna have to negotiate.  Besides, all the crap floating around reduces visibility to the extent where I doubt having helmet lights would have make that much difference, anyway.  Maintenance lights down there oughta be enough to do the trick.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Tight.  We chose a route we felt would reduce the chance of you running into any Aliens.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Forget it.  I wouldn't ask somebody to do something I wouldn't do myself.  Where's the disk?

Speaker: driscoll
Dialogue: Here.  If you got to use 'em, make 'em count.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Let's just run through it one more time so I know you've got it straight.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Okay, I pull the access panel off of the console.  Insert the disk, and press the green enabling button...

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Right.  When you've done that, don't waste any time getting out of there.  Once that crane starts moving...well, it's bound to provoke some kind of response.

Speaker: york
Dialogue: You'll need this for the gratings. Trigger finger to operate, thumb button to switch over to the rivet gun.  The sensors'll choose blade or socket heads automatically.

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Alright, let's open her up.  Carefully, now...

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: What?  What's wrong?  What is it?

Speaker: york
Dialogue: Suicide run, man.  Fuckin' suicide run.

Speaker: grease monkey
Dialogue: Okay.  Back.  Back.  Little bit more...

Speaker: thomas
Dialogue: They're comin' up through the pit!

Speaker: parsons
Dialogue: Quick!  Run a trace on the culvert leading off the auto-shop maintenance pit.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: Drains right into the Central Reservoir.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: What was that?  I don't copy.

Speaker: cassie
Dialogue: I can't reach her.  Too much signal break-up.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Okay, I make it to the crane.  You...

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Yeah, well don't get too carried away; we're only halfway home. Talk...

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: No 'buts'.  Just do it.  Noguchi out.

Speaker: guttierez
Dialogue: Move it baby, or they're gonna be chewin' on my cojones!

Speaker: de vries
Dialogue: That's it!  We've got it!  Get us out of here.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Look.  Don't take this the wrong way, but when I imagined the cavalry coming to my rescue... they never looked like you.

Speaker: kamen
Dialogue: I can... feel it moving around inside me. You've got to kill me.

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: If you don't move your ugly butt, we're gonna end up barbecued!  Come on!

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Okay, Butch.  I can play cavalry, too...

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: Watch your shots!  If you hit the engine you'll blow us both to hell!

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: We've lost the starboard engine!  We're going down!  Hold on!

Speaker: hiroko
Dialogue: We've gotta get you out of here.
